item.description:
A roughly 4.25 mile easy looping hike (just slight rolling) at Northwest Park in Windsor. We'll pass through field, forest, and nice evergreen forest with views of the reservoir about half way through.

Meet at the parking lot at 2:45 PM. We'll hike from the parking lot and take the following trails or portions of trails: Bookside, Open Forest, Triassic, Rainbow Reservoir, Wetland Forest, and back to the parking lot. Children and leashed dogs are welcome. The hike will take about 2.25 hours and be done by about 5 PM at the latest.

Please wear something waterproof for potential mud on the trail. Hiking boots would be great. Also, bring some water.

Directions:
* From Interstate 91 heading north, take Exit 38. From Interstate 91 heading south, take Exit 38A.
* Turn right at the exit on to Poquonock Avenue (Route 75).
* Go about 1.5 miles and turn left on to Prospect Hill Rd.
* Turn right at the traffic circle on to Lang Road
* Continue up the road to the Nature Center parking lot.

Approximate location/directions via MapQuest:
http://www.mapquest.c...

Trail map:
http://www.northwestp...

For more information about Northwest Park and programs:
http://www.northwestp...


=== Legal Stuff ===
By clicking on "Yes" or "Maybe" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows:

In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
item.how_to_find_us: Dark blue Dodge Grandcaravan, CT plates. Meet at hike location.
item.why: An fairly easy almost spring hike experience without much difficulty! Some mud likely but not likely to be much issue.
